content: This is a 20* app when it comes to value. Thank you for a brilliant effort.
Excellent. Can save more measuring points, areas.
Said I needed another part for phone?
So far I like it better than factory flir's app. Better focus..more technical, thanks
Waaaay better than the Flir One app. The + version of this is well worth it.
Cat S61 support?
Like the app as it shows max and min value at the same time. Would have loved it to show auto marked (crosshair or points) where those max and min values is on frame at the same time.
It didn't work for me. Waste of money.

Better resolution and picture quality than the FLIR app. Downside: Even when set to Manual recalibrate, it still performs calibrations which cause temperature changes between readings. Some enhancements that would make it killer: -Multiple temperature sensing cursors. Now it has only one. The great thing is that you can actually move it around the image, unlike the FLIR app where it is fixed. Having more than one would cut my measurement times in half or better. -Ability to record video

I'm really glad this app exists, because it provides functionality (like locking the temperature scale) not provided by the official Flir app. But the app is unpolished and buggy: There are glitches in choosing the color pallette, UI elements overlap on my Pixel 3a, and I often have to swipe the app out of my rscents to get the normal camera working again. I'll use it a lot, but wish it was better.
Absolutely love it....user friendly an way more possible combinations of contrast an color than the Flir app itself

It's too complicated for the average person to operate the temperature is in celsius it does not show fehrenheit it said to turn on camera but doesn't show how to do it there is no button to switch on and im pretty good when it comes to figuring things out but i have to admit it had me stumped! I uninstalled the app. ðŸ˜²

It works very well if you understand how to use the camera properly. Lots of manual control that takes time to learn, but can produce a very good picture. Only problems I had was a limitation of the camera sensor itself. As the camera gets hot the grain or noise increases. I have the s60

IMHO, I found this app to be only a partial step above the free version. I also feel that the 1st gen devices are better for more defined and robust pic quality for the end user experience VS the gen 2 devices. The USB-C port on the 2nd gen device is an excellent upgrade vs the 1st gen USB mini port. FLIR was very generous with me. When I reached out to them regarding if I was able to purchase adapters for use on phones with a case. I received adapters free but the issue is still not resolved
I am Surprised,. It works great on Samsung Galaxy Fold. I am using a GEN 3 FLIR One.
Neither one did not explain well I cannot use this on my device it won't work. I have to uninstall it it may work for somebody else may be great but it won't work on mine sorry

OnePlus6t (tmobile version) & FlirOnePro. Just got the thermal imaging unit today and this is the first app i tried with the unit. So much fun. Great features. Thanks so much! Keep it coming!
Works great, my only gripe is that I can't take video with this app. Once that's implemented then It's a 5 star app.

Great for my flir one much better than the std app

Oddly, the official app just crashes my phone....this one works. 4 stars because while I'm sure all the features I need are there, it's definitely not an intuitive enough UI to just get going. I'll have to spend some time getting familiar with the app.

Great alternative app to the stock one, good functionality and flexibility. the only thing that would be excellent to have is the ability to change the temp range mode for the camera without having to use the Flir One app. keep up the good work

Works well with my FLIR Pro LT and Xaiomi Mix 2S. I love the customization. Screen layout needs work though. UI elements overlap, tons of wasted space, icons right on the screen edges etc. Also there's a rare bug that prevents the icon bar from being displayed again. Going in and out of Settings seems to correct it though. Also no love for landscape mode. All in all a great effort that I support with my money. Very functional as-is.

useless Waster money!

This app does not work well at all! It crashes my phone, Galaxy S5. The app crashes. And when it did work before crashing the image was of terable quality. I want a refund.

Nice app, maybe not as 'slick' as the official app, but it's much more versatile. Two things: - App crashes when I try to share an image. (Moto G6+)  - A nice addition would be a flashlight button.

I love the app, and I'm using it more than the Flir one.  The 3$(only!) is worth the investment. Respect to the maker. A suggestion maybe to place future icon to quick flip 90' when you rotate the phone/device so that the image follows.  Best regards, hope you make more awesome stuff!
I like this app

Garbage app, flir one's proprietary app is far more superior than this 
garbage, don't waste your money here!

They were really hard to make out on screen. Tried several settings on the

Works great, a bit of getting used to settings wise. Helped me find my 
rooms had no insulation.
Unlike the flir one app this one works!, well worth buying as it does not crash for me .  Made my purchase worthwhile.

This app is worth the investment if you have the proper hardware. The 
clarity in the images is far superior to the authentic flir app. My only 
suggestion would be to remove the tea cup in the paid version, it's rather 
annoying otherwise kudos

Better then Flir native app. However many small issues. If Dev can fix 
issues I will be glad to adjust rating. #1) Thermal photos and Visual 
photos do not match alighnment when holding phone 180 degrees. Looks file 
while using app, but either the visual or thermal will be upside down upon 
review. Default orientation does not fix this. #2) Allow gamma change even 
in MX mode (If possible)? Perhaps gamma left right swipe, alighnment 
up/down? #3) Fix alignment/parralax... touch UI does not always adjust, 
seems it has bug.

For all of those that are stating that the app doesn't work it happened to 
me also, when I installed the app on my LG note and my work phone which is 
also a LG phone it wouldn't work all I saw was a black screen, I 
uninstalled the app and reinstalled it several times but it did the same 
thing. After I thought of installing it on a Motorola brand phone it worked 
perfectly, the app will not work on certain kind of phones depends on what 
system they're running under keep that in mind that the phone might be 
outdated and it might be time to get a upgrade. With that said I will 
change my phone to a different phone app works like a charm.

This app sucks beyond belief. It is not user friendly and the instructions 
are not clear. Fake a$$ positive reviews!!

I like the app, but it has some weird bugs sometimes. I'm not 100% convinced it's the app though, or the FLIR SDK that they're using, but the app occasionally crashes, doesn't detect the camera, or is slower than normal.  They have a few cool options as opposed the FLIR app, but I wish it was a bit customizable.  For example, pictures with SR on aren't saved with the device rotation if I take pictures in landscape mode.

It works on my LG6 using Flirone pro. The apps adapt to the flirone pro although it was designed for gen2. A temp vs time graph with video capability recording would be an added bonus, perhaps for the nexy update.
Best thermal imaging app for the Cat S60.

Great app for the Flir One! I've recommended it to anyone I know with compatible hardware. Everyone has thanked me. I've also contacted the dev to suggest some features and they've been implemented in latest release! Thanks!
This app is super well done. Since I purchased it  it has been my Go-to app for my FLIR One Pro.  It is very well thought out. Lots of refinements! Thanks!

Great app, I like it better than FLIR's apps. There are some features I would like to have though: 1.   The option to display the crosshair temperature under the crosshair or the ability to drag and drop the crosshair. I find it inconvenient in portrait mode to look at the bottom of the screen to read the temperature, it's difficult to concentrate on both the image in real time and the crosshair temperature, if for example I want to focus on a moving object.   2.   Add multiple crosshairs to monitor temperature of two locations/objects simultaneously. Seems like there's plenty of free space in the bottom pane for extra rows of status information.   3.   Toggle to show temperature under max and min arrows.   4.   Remember last MSX mode or an option to configure the default. Everytime I open the app I need to enable MSX mode.  5.   Capture raw data to a snapshot to a known format and a viewer to reproduce frame and interact with it (touch a spot to see temperature)   6.   Capturing Video.  7.   A floating thermal camera widget, would be great to get a preview in the foreground of applications. A home screen or lockscreen widget would also be neat, I know it's possible to view an application activity in keyguard, including previewing from a regular camera.  8.   Option for PIP for real camera over thermal. Similar to the reason I mentioned with having the crosshair temperature under the crosshair.   9.   All features in MSX mode, if it ever becomes possible with the framework. That would include min/max temp arrows, drag and drop crosshair, etc. Would also be neat if it were possible to disable the regular camera in MSX mode so I only have the thermal image/data showing (not talking about the regular camera display on the bottom right).
Does not detect camera with note 8. Returning
Works on my nexus 5x as advertised. A timelapse or video mode would be appreciated
Works fine to take images. But how do I analize the images already savedï¼Ÿ
replyContent: Go to settings and save images also as "Thermal Image II". Then open this radiometric jpg in App Flir Tools.

content: Great app, just tested on the CAT S60 and works a treat, uses both cameras too, brilliant app to replace the MyFLIR app preinstalled on the phone...

Option to turn on the camera flashlight would be a plus for close up work...also a button to close the app.  Finally having the temparature reading of the marker on screen (picture) as an option would be a plus..as would having 2 temperature cursors... Overall good app.

Live video doesn't work with n5x and flir one pro, but way faster than flir's app. Like the min/max on the scale, perhaps a weight map could be added? Shame there's no mix mode, but I imagine that's a copyright thing. Oh yes, no watermarks too!

I read that the FLIR ONE PRO has problems using it on Samsung Note 8.  I didn't install the FLIR own program (after reading about all the problems associated with it) - instead,  I went ahead to buy this version and installed it (knowing that Google will refund me if the test goes wrong).  To my surprise, it works perfectly on my Note 8.  Thank you, Georg - for creating a viable alternative to the manufacturer's own software.  I am not certain what incompatibilities with FLIR ONE PRO there are - but - it appears to work.

Works great with my Pixel and third gen FLIR One Pro with just one exception; the MSX feature doesn't work. Otherwise, this is the BEST app for getting the most out of thd FLIR One. Running Android Oreo for the record.
Any plans to support 3gen and pro? I got a pro but paid for the app anyway to support development. Pro kind of works with the free version. Keep it up! :)
If you have the s60, it's worth the few dollars. for sure
Nice hack. Doubles resolution of a Flir 1 for cheap.
Does not show Fahrenheit does Kelvin and Celsius I should have bought seat the seek camera much better software and usability
replyContent: You can change the unit used, in the options. Look at the gear icon.

content: I like the dual view of both cameras from the FLIR One.
please add streaming facebook and youtube. this would make this even more awsome.
I love this app. My flir one pro wouldn't be as interesting without it.
Not displaying the correct temperature and big difference from actual. I use the Flir Owner app and not using this

YOU ARE A GOLDEN GOD!!!!!!  It's huge money when we lose a hydraulic system at work and the FLIR ONE has made keeping track of even small changes in the health of our hydraulic systems a breeze. I have about 60 aging CNC machines to care for, and the original FLIR ONE app has been an utter disaster since the dreaded "update".  I've been passing TS Surveillance Audits by the seat of my pants with this camera, but the updated FLIR ONE app had rendered the camera a paper weight... its just so godawful... thermal selfies... that app used to be great but its been utterly gutted just so FLIR can market the FLIR ONE to social media zombies... Camera is absolutely not functioning in any android system... both flir apps crash or freeze instantly.  I had taken about 5000 photos with FLIR ONE gen.2 and then used the windows version of FLIR TOOLS to properly adjust and colorize everything using MSX to blend about 70% thermal with 30% color image. We use these thermal images for training, troubleshooting, visual work instructions, audits...  I will try your app at work today. Even if it doesn't work I'll still be glad I bought it. The features you designed into this app do the FLIR ONE justice and you deserve to be recognized for the efforts you made.   I mean, teacup mode, three different image formats, a real emissivity setting (FLIR ONE APP locked it at .90....sigh), max/min, a great user manual, FLIR TOOLS compatibility... just take my money, you restored a bit of my faith in humanity.

This app transforms Flir One 2nd gen from a simple toy to an advance tool! Very satisfied with the app, everything works like it should. Picture is excellent quality - I was able to locate a faulty component (SOP8 package) on a laptop motherboard in no time.
Getting worse after every bug fixed
So far, the only app that works with my flir one pro for android as of 7.20.2017. Can't take pictures, and haven't tried all the options, but it does work. Thanks for saving the day.
Installed it on my Cat S60 several months ago, works great, never used the stock app again.
First time everytime you try and start the app it crashes on the S60. Then on the second time its fine. Seems laggy compared to stock FLIR app.
Better by far than the "official" app from FLIR. Well done. Worth the minor cost to go '+'.
App crashes on Google pixel.

June 22, 2017. Definitely a good app, with some wrinkles. Many positive points like image quality, the gamut scale, movable pointer with clear reading, well designed controls, compatibility with FLIR Tools, and saving files in different formats. It is a stable app. But...  First of all, it shows notably different temperatures on different devices (about 5 degrees Celsius difference between my Nexus 6P and Samsung Galaxy Tab S). Landscape mode  ( or autorotate) is inexistent, the same with video and the useful time lapse. Real color image is very tilted, actually worthless, on the Nexus 6P.
replyContent:
Thank you for nice feedback. 
But some points you made sound interesting. Can you please write me per mail on thermalcamera.app@gmail.com ?

content: Huge Upgrade from stock Cat s60. Great Job!!!!! Would like to see a full screen version tho.
100% would recommend anyone with FLIR to make this their default app. Truly is the most superior FLIR app available.
Used on forest fire, very useful
An excellent alternative for Cat S60 owners, it is a more powerful app with several useful options not found in MyFLIR. No ugly watermarking of images, either.
Great work, far better then disappointing stock app, hopefully the video and time-lapse will come in future updates, we'll worth purchase keep up good work
Best app for flir one and works even with honor8 and flir one in otg supported microusb to usb-c adapter!
Needs the following please: Video recording. Timelapse capability  Floating hottest or coldest pointer. But otherwise great thanks
replyContent:
For the Hottest and Coldest pointers please take a look into the manual:
http://thermcam.binaryblogger.de/manualA/index.html#minmax_triangles

The other features will maybe implemented in the next updates.

content: This is so much better than the stock app.  I have a CAT S60 and before I got this app I was disappointed with the FLIR, but this app makes it much easier to use and it doesn't have the video lag that the stock app has.

App is buggy and customer service is terrible. App is better than the Flir One app but is still poorly built. The app is like someone's high school tech project and got a D.  Settings don't save from one use to another. Another reviewer mentioned wanting to use the camera in full screen ... but the developer's response is that's not how he wants the app to be used. There's an option to remove the viewer on the lower corner, why not make it full screen then?  Last annoying thing is not being able to pick the SD card to store photos--not even an option!
replyContent: I'm sorry that you don't like the app, but everybody can take a grasp of the concept and design by simply downloading the free version. If you don't like it there, why should you buy the pro version?

content: on my cat s60 this app is undoubtedly superior to the stock app. the image clarity is noticeably better. Also, when the phone is in motion the image seems smoother and more forgiving than the stock app which gets a bit jumpy unless i pan slowly. i would definitely recommend giving this app a try if you're using it with Cat S60 phone.
Bought to fix Flir One program but with current build it keeps crashing on my s7 active.  Need to get this fixed ASAP or I have a $200 worthless piece of equipment.
replyContent: If the original FLIR ONE app crashes, you should ask the FLIR ONE support for an exchange device. We've currently 15 successful installations running on S7 Active phones.

content: Way better than the native flir app tha came on the cat s60. Worth every penny.

Nice app but I feel a lot of screen real estate is taken up by the camera etc icons at the bottom of the screen. The developer could easily redesign them to use half the space leaving more for the thermal image.
replyContent: Sorry, but the concept of the app is to display both images (real color and thermal) simultaneously in their full resolution.

content: Has all sorts of awesome functionality and allows tinkering with the technical aspects of the Flir One. Make sure you read the manual, as there's a lot of hidden functionality.  Surprisingly easy to use, though--everything is just a tap or two away. Would love to see video and timelapse support at some point; then it'd be a complete replacement for Flir's app.

Very good! This adds several useful features over the official app, like the original thermal image and improved quality. Well worth the bucks. One feature is missing however: is there a way to have video recording? Thanks!
This app is amazing, increased viewing angle of the FLIR ONE by 30% in my device!

Great app. Better than the native Flir One app. It works beautifully with my Samsung Galaxy S6. Highly recommended !   A few additional requests for product enhancement: 1. Video mode 2. Timelapse mode  One question- how do I ensure that the gallery function uses the Flir Tools Gallery and not the built-in gallery ? I see your screenshots have the Flir Tools Gallery.
replyContent:
We're thinking about implementing those.

When you activate "Save in Flir Tools folder" and Flir Tools is installed, the Flir Tools Icon will then appear on the right of the settings icon.

content: This works as expected on the crappy moto G series 3. As others have noted, the addition of video would be excellent. Also is it possible to change from internal to an external source to save data? Finally, is it possible to take images on a timer, say every five seconds? This would provide a nudge towards a video feed if it cannot be easily implemented within the SDK. I will have to have a delve into the SDK myself. Thanks again.
Better than the original Flir One app with one exception. There is no way to record video in this app. Add that and it is everything you could want.
Endless loop of open app - connect device - app crashes. And yes I checked permissions and uninstalled the official app.
replyContent: We have hundreds succesfull installations on Galaxy S7's. Does the Camera work with the original Flir One App? Write me per mail please.

content: Following all directions,  app starts for a second then freezes,  restarting the flir camera takes you back to the connect camera and turn it on.  Endless inoperable circle,  please fix this app.
replyContent:
Look for your app permissions (uninstall and reinstall the app, uninstall also the free app). 
We count more as 10 succesfull working installations on your hardware (Motorola Droid Turbo)

content: Both flir apps are garbage .. wont start or when it does it runs and turns off seconds later.. want a refund.....
replyContent: You use an Galaxy Note 5. We have 50 succesfull running installations on this hardware. Please check you app permissions and uninstall the free app.

content: An excellent application. Provides much better camera function support than Flir's app.  Well worth the money.
Can't open/edit images when camera isn't attached. Otherwise I may have rated higher.
replyContent: Could you write me per mail. I think that the problem can be easily fixed.

content: Thanks very much!

Outstanding app. The official app is an embarrassment compared to this. Also requires no login, and allows access to media while offline. Thanks for such good work. Bought the paid version right away.

This app is great for the FLIR One. It improves the thermal image clarity for a smoother looking picture/image. It has more color pallets as well. $2.99 well spent and the software is stable on Samsung GS7 (for as long as I have been using it so far).Keep the updates coming, video would be an awesome addition.
Wonderful app, does great work, plus version worth it 100 times. Video would be nice though.
Does not work on a brand new Samsung s7 active...will try again later after the bugs are removed
replyContent: We've currently 10 active installations of the Galaxy S7 Active. I think I could help you. Please write me a support mail.

content: Fixed.**thank you**. Needs to support Android update
replyContent: Sorry, but we have currently 14x "DROID Turbo 2" devices on which the app works fine.

content: Works as described!
Stopped working after update

This app is simply the best one for FLIR ONE. It got high res image and live max min temp. Please, add more feature like 2nd, 3rd or more thermal spot and also graphical statistics for the spot. And also capability for video is also important. Thanks.
imaging was accurate
Fantastic app.  10 times better than the Flir One app.  Maybe they should employ his services and get rid of their SW team :)
Needs to add Fahrenheit
replyContent: Go into the settings and select the Fahrenheit inside the favorite units. You can easily switch between them by pressing on the unit inside the quick settings menu.

content: Great work...maybe an option to turn off the temperature scale for when you want to do thermalphotography. That way I won't have to crop it out.

Much better than the native software on the Cat S60 (which always under reads by 4 degrees C!) Like the calibration functions, temperature readings are more accurate all seems to work well, except the ordinary image which is diagonally skewed and unusable. Odd because it works perfectly in MSX mode. Tried restarting the device but no change. What's all that about?
replyContent: Can you please send me some details about this bug over my support mail? It sounds interesting.

content: It is a really good app, it has a lot of features that are not in the one from Flir, like including range and setting Max and Min values manually.
Didn't work on my phone want my refund and it won't work please refund my money
Has nothing of importance, requires another hardware of 249 USD , without it you end up with a big farce both FLir and FLir one are duds

Wonderfully intuitive app for the FLIR one. Works well with the Nexus 6p, though the camera needs to be connected via a micro to C type USB adaptor making it more vulnerable to knocks. Great work Georg!
Love it
Flir one turned on and plugged in. This keeps saying no camera found.
replyContent: Try to contact the Flirt Support. Most cases where that happened was due to a hardware bug of the Flir One Camera itself.

content: Far better than the official app. Flir should be paying this developer for making an app worthy of the hardware!
Unlocks the potential of the camera
Great app...thanks!

Amazing! This app can be used on MORE phones and tablets than the official app. It also runs faster (higher frame rate) on older phones by turning off smoothing, and preview image.  My Toshiba Excite Pro has a big screen but it's old and the official app doesn't support it - yet I've been able to use it by using this program! This paid for version comes with super resolution - awesome!. Great work by the programmer. SHUT UP AND TAKE MY MONEY!

This is absolutely a must have app if you have a Flir One! It expands on several extremely useful features, and adds quite a few more. The ability to manually set the temp span alone is worth the download. (Protip: Hold and drag on the color bar and you can scrunch the readings in one end of the range or another!). 8D
Works great with Sony Xperia Z2 and Flir ONE, many thanks.
